intro: Leucanthemum ircutianum subsp. ircutianum, commonly known as the Siberian geranium, is a perennial herb native to the temperate regions of Asia. It features a basal rosette of narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces daisy-like flowers with white petals and a yellow center. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–40 cm and thrives in well-drained soil and full sun. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively low maintenance. This species is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
